text: <@U026PT0D7>: in the main trap view - is there a desired sort order?   like most recent closest to the top?

the documents array controller is wired (via data binding in the storyboard) to `documentsFilterPredicate` and `documentsSortDescriptors`, the latter of which defaults to "sort by document trapped date descending, any ties to be broken by document title ascending"
I did notice some documents had identical trapped dates, hence the tiebreaker
ah - slick...   I've never dealt with NSArrayController before - it seems cool
As far as I know they dont exist in iOS
nope. i've run into a few differences like that

for instance, NSAnimation gives things a method `animator` so instead of needing CA or UIView to animate layout constraints like we do in iOS, we can simply write `[[layoutConstraint animator] setConstant:foo]`
<@U0289USNA> I've pushed a few commits to origin/master. At this point "client-specific resources" is pretty solid, I think.
